conclusion: Use properties of semicircle and law of reflection to solve the problem.
Identify given information: radius R, laser beam injected perpendicularly from center O to diameter MN, angle between emitted and incident light is 30 degrees.
Since laser beam is perpendicular to diameter, angle of incidence equals angle of reflection, angle between incident light and normal at point of incidence is 30 degrees.
Using law of reflection, angle of incidence equals angle of reflection, angle between incident light and normal at point of incidence is 30 degrees.
Angle between emitted light and incident light is 30 degrees, angle between emitted light and normal at point of incidence is also 30 degrees, refractive index of material is 1.
Refractive index is ratio of speed of light in material to speed of light in vacuum.
Since angle of incidence equals angle of reflection, refractive index is 1.
Refractive index is 1, material is transparent and allows light to pass without significant loss of energy.
Refractive index of material to monochromatic light is 1.
The refractive index of the transparent material to monochromatic light is 1.
